oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Microwave-assisted palladium mediated decarbonylation reaction: synthesis of eulatachromene
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: AKANKSHA
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RHODIUM-CATALYZED DECARBONYLATION
KHAND-TYPE REACTION
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
ALDEHYDES
CHEMISTRY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Microwave-assisted decarbonylation reactions were investigated using a palladium catalyst. A large number of aldehydes can be decarbonylated efficiently with lower catalyst loadings and under shorter reaction times compared to conventional heating. A successful decarbonylation led to the synthesis of natural product eulatachromene in three steps starting from easily available materials.
